entry.title: Combined summary - Standardizing OP_RETURN message format
entry.summary: Maciej Trebacz has proposed a process BIP to standardize OP_RETURN transactions for better interoperability between services. He suggests creating a common, extensible protocol that can be used by anyone. The generic format would be like this: OP_RETURN OP_PUSHDATA[length] {2-byte message type} {data}. He also proposes a list of message types that can be parsed by everyone because the format is open; however, it was suggested not to make it easier for third-parties to determine what the OP_RETURN messages are for as it might lead to censorship. Additionally, it was recommended not to restrict oneself to OP_RETURN as it is not certain that it will survive in its present form.In an email conversation on April 6th, 2014, Maciej Trebacz discussed a method of destroying coins through a Proof of Burn transaction. This involves sending all the coins as fees to miners, effectively removing them from circulation. However, for those who only require a dummy output for an all fee transaction, there is no need for a PUSH at all.The author asks if they can expect their ideas for these kinds of messages to be included with other BIPs if they write it. Overall, the proposed standardization of OP_RETURN transactions would create a more unified approach to crafting these transactions, instead of everyone doing whatever they believe is best for them.
